subject: RE: [junit] Help, can test cases be retrieved from the package they are in?
messageBody:
Google for "RecursiveTestSuite".

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Jeff Schlaver
> Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2006 7:31 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Help, can test cases be retrieved from the
> package they are in?
>
>
> I'm relatively new but this seam like something that can be
> done and that someone should have done it by now, or am I way
> off on this thought.
>
> I have been give around 160 separate unit test files, instead
> of listing them one line at a time.
> Is there a way I can grab them from the package directory and
> do a mass add of the test cases at run time?
>
> I was hoping I can loop through all the classes in a package,
> since all the testcases are in the same package.
> (package com.thc.ids.application.hcs.test.CalculatorTest.tests;)
>
> I was hoping to be able to some kind of mass add of the 160
> test case files. Below is a sample of 4 of the 160.
>
>
>
> public class TestLabSuite
> {
> public static void main( String[] args )
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run( suite() );
> }
>
> public static TestSuite suite()
> {
> TestSuite result =3D new TestSuite();
>
> // Labs
> //result.addTest(LabAdvisorKeywordSearchTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabAdvisorTopicSearchTest.suite() );
>
> // Added by HCL
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchExtendedTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchTest.suite() );
> result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchThirdTest.suite() );
>
> return result;
> }
> }
>
> Thanks for any guidance you can provide
>
> Jeff
